## Description
The **Deliver packages (EI) **task allows to deliver packages of invoices to SDI. It consumes the output of the **Create packages (EI) **task.

## Configuration
**![](data:image/png;base64,)**

- In the **Alias **field, enter the name of the task that will be displayed in the workflow.

## Input
The expected input of the **Deliver packages (EI) **task is the output of the Create packages (EI) task:

- Signed **FI package(s)**

- *(optional) ***eipa.delay file **for delaying the sending of the EI package to SdI

## Output
None.

## Delay the sending of packages to SdI
The sending of the package to SdI can be delayed by configuring an **eipa.delay file **that is propagated by the Manage Invoices (EI) and Create Packages (EI) tasks to this task.

**Example eipa.delay file**

`FROM_DATE=yyyy-MM-dd
EXPIRY_DATE=yyyy-MM-dd`If the input contains an **eipa.delay file**, the task will perform the following steps:

- Validate the values of **FROM_DATE **and/or **EXPIRY_DATE **(both optional). The file will be ignored if either of these values is misconfigured.

- If the value of **FROM_DATE **is valid, the **fromDate **element will be enriched as a child of the **lot **element.

- If the value of **EXPIRY_DATE **is valid, the **expiryDate **element will be enriched as a child of the **lot **element.

**Example output from processing the eipa.delay file**

`&lt;fromDate&gt;yyyy-MM-dd&lt;/fromDate&gt;
&lt;expiryDate&gt;yyyy-MM-dd&lt;/expiryDate&gt;`> Note

Invoices which have been sent to SdI with the Deliver packages (EI) task will transition to status **SENT_SDI**. A delivery outcome status will appear (for example **DELIVERED_SDI**) once the invoices have been received by the Electronic Invoicing core database.
